review_content: This product is really good! I definitely recommend it if you’re a minimalist because this product is a great multitasker and it looks really natural. The only complaint I have is that the color clings a bit more to any dry areas on the cheeks. It’s not terrible, i’ll for sure keep using it but it’s just something to keep in mind in case you have very dry skin.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml

review_content: Love this product. Have pale skin and this always makes me look "alive". Easy to use; lasts all day; and a little goes a long way. Good value for money.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: GREAT Color but needs more hydration
review_content: LOVE the tint that this leaves on my lips. It's the perfect casual flush of red without looking too overdone. However, I feel like it dries out my lips. I fix this by putting on lip balm immediately after applying this but would love for the formula to be more hydrating. Also occasionally used on my cheeks when I have forgotten my blush and it blends well.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: My go to blush for 15 years!!
review_content:
I’ve been using this for about 15 years now and still love it! I love the way it smells and even though my skin is very tan, it shows with 2 applications. You have to be careful not to leave it on too long after applying with the brush and before dabbing with your fingers. I usually apply 3 streaks/lines one cheek at a time and wait a few seconds before rubbing it in. I waited too long one time and my friend told me I had 3 lines on my cheeks and looks like someone scratched me! If I rub it in immediately after applying, it doesn’t show. It stains pretty easily and stays on my fingertips for a long time, even after washing with soap and water. Gives you confidence that it stays on your skin a while, but be careful splattering light colored sinks too!

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I love this product. People who say it’s trash don’t know how to apply it. This is a product that needs your fingers for it to work. Dab dab dab and if you want to build it up, swipe it on with the little brush applicator and dab some more. I first bought this because it was recommended by Alexis Ren (that beachy sun-loving girl on Instagram) and I was hooked. It gives you that natural sun kissed look. I really hope benetint doesn’t stop making this product because I wouldn’t know where else to look.

I use it on my cheeks under my foundation to give that youthful blush and I use it on my lips to give just a hint of pink having to reapply throughout the day. It's not very showy and loud like a scream stain but it just gives just enough color. product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I compared Love Tint (doe foot applicator) to Benetint (brush applicator). I preferred the color of Benetint which layers to this awesome rosey flushed color that I love. I prefer the texture of Love Tint but the color was less natural/too pink for my liking. I’m mixed race African American and European/Caucasian. My skin tone is similar to Halle Berry or Beyoncé. I have a neutral undertone. My friend who has very fair skin with a cool undertone uses this same cheek stain and I LOVE it on her. Never in a million years did I think we could use the same shade of blush. We have different skin colors AND different undertones. How is that possible? I think this cheek stain might be magical... (I prefer the texture of Love Tint which is more like a cream. It’s easier/less messy to apply. Benetint (brush) is very thin and liquidy. Liquidy? That’s not a real word... I I didn’t realize Benetint came in the thicker cream formula with the doe foot applicator until I decided to post this review. I kind want to try that now. Assuming the two Benetint formulas are the same exact color I might go with the cream formula when this finally runs out... in like 5 years. Seriously, this stuff lasts FOREVER.

review_content:
THIS FOR ALL MY LADIES (and men, and whatever pronoun you prefer) WHO HAVE TINY LIPS!!! The good Lord did not bestow me with full lips. It’s okay, it only makes me a stronger person. In the interim, I love using this stuff because it gives the **illusion** that I have slightly below average sized lips as opposed to thin, lizard lips. product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Benetint is one of my all-time favorites. It is very pigmented (so you know you’re getting your money’s worth!), yet easy to lightly apply. In lighter layers, it gives my cheeks and lips a rose blush. In heavier layers, it gives my lips a bright fuchsia stain. It wears all day and is perfect for a fresh, naturally blushed look. To apply evenly to lips, I exfoliate first with a toothbrush. I leave them slightly damp so that the stain spreads evenly as I apply with the applicator. Then, I finish with a lip balm and I’m good to go! The smaller-sized (0.10 oz?) lasted me nearly a year with light usage. Absolutely worth the price!

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I have been using Benetint on and off for years and I always come back! I don't typically wear foundation so blush alone doesn't always stay on very long. product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This product is too thin and watery for use on the cheeks, unless you apply it with your fingers on bare skin. Even then, I find that it's often too splotchy. It is, however, beautiful on the lips. It does require some trial and error to find the amount that's right for your skin tone, and sometimes it can look a little barbie-esque on my very pale skin. It does have an awful taste, but that goes away. TL;DR It's nice on the lips, but not on the cheeks. Requires some trial and error. Would recommend only buying the mini because its easy to use on the go for a flush of color on the lips.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I really like this stuff. The main thing to remember is to have MOISTURIZED skin before using this as a cheek tint. If you put it on dry skin it gets patchy but if skin is moisturized it will blend very evenly with just one finger. Don’t over blend as it will disappear.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Going through my 2nd bottle - absolutely adore it! The best thing about it is that it can be built on. You can make it really subtle OR you can really build it up and make it really red - and either way it makes SUCH A LOVELY DIFFERENCE. I use it on my lips at all times, whether I'm wearing make up or not. I have also used it on my cheeks, and I really like the subtle rosey blush it creates. I can see it working for a wide range of skin tones, which is nice! I am giving it 4 stars because a) it has a weird taste (which is not unbearable but some people might dislike), and b) it can be a bit drying, which is annoying particularly during winter.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I've been using this product on and off since like 2005/2006. I've kept coming back to it because I know I can depend on it as a versatile tint for cheeks and lips. A little goes a long way, 2-3 dots on each cheek does the trick for me. I dab it on my lips sometimes too which gives the look of having just eaten a cherry popsicle. I also like to layer this with the Dandelion Shy Beam by applying the shy beam first the way you would blush and then blending a bit of benetint on top of of the shy beam. I use a little more shy beam than the benetint to get the right shade since benetint is more pigmented. it gives more dimension and an ethereal yet natural looking transition from the benetint color to the shy beam (which is more like a highlighter).

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I had been looking for a liquid or cream blush since I don’t usually wear foundation and a powder blush wouldn’t stay on my face. I decided to try Benetint and I was really impressed. The best way to apply this product is to put 3 dots in a triangle formation on the apples of your cheeks and blend out. Most reviews say that it dries fast and this is true but if you do one cheek quickly at a time you’ll be left with awesome results.

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I got this from the rewards bazaar and I love this stain. I was previously using a liquid blush that is a pretty pink, but I’ve been wanting to try a deeper shade and this fits perfectly. You do need to layer it if you want more pigment and I think that is good if you are new to blushes like this. I can’t really use it as a lip stain since my lips are so dry and most lip stains never look good on me anyway, also I would say the fragrance isn’t my favorite for the lips, but it is manageable. I’ll be buying this when I run out of my sample. It seems to work great even over my luminous silk powder foundation, I’m not sure how other powders would react, but so far it blended nicely.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Part of my daily makeup routine
review_content: I have been using Benetint daily for over 10 years and figured it was about time I wrote a review. I love the natural rosy tint (and scent!) for my lips and use it either under lipbalm or a combo of lipbalm and lipstick for an extra pop of colour. The standard sized bottle lasts me over 2 years, and I'm still working through my mini sized one after 1 year. A great staple for any makeup kit!

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
This was really weird but it works well and smells amazing. I wasn’t thrilled with the tint on my cheeks just because it went on oddly and was hard to maneuver the way I wanted it. It was also really sticky feeling. However, on my lips I really loved it! It’s a nice natural color and I actually had to do a few layers to darken it up. This is good if you’re going for a natural look. I usually line my lips and this looked totally different on my skin around the lips vs on my actual lips, which is why I said it will definitely only be used on my natural days. If you don’t line your lips and want to add a little oomph to your daily look this is great for you!
…read more

product_name: Benefit Cosmetics Benetint Cheek & Lip Stain 10ml
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This does give a nice rosiness to the cheek, and I like that it's such a thin consistency. I find that cream or liquid products can look so much more natural on the skin. This does dry fairly quickly on the skin, so work fast. I also find that if I put the brush directly on my skin after some use the bottle turns cloudy, likely from getting foundation on the brush. If I tap it onto my fingers then onto my cheeks this works much better and is nicer to blend as I don't get any marks from parts that dried down to fast. On the lips this is very drying and needs a gloss over it, and for me... I might as well just use a gloss. Also be careful, if the lid cracks at all, you'll get leaks if you put it in a makeup bag. Storing upright on a counter or shelf will allow you to keep the product, its just not as handy for me. This is an okay product, but I think I'll move on to trying something new next time.
